dnimp
Class World

java.lang.Object
  dnimp.World

public class World
extends java.lang.Object

A representation of all or part of the Northern Hemisphere, segmented into grids with a specified dimension.

The world spans a specified latitude and longitude relevant to the northern hemisphere and is represented by an array of Grid objects. The dimensions of the grid determines the resolution obtained in further data analyses.

Constructor Detail

World

public World(int lon,
             int lat,
             double dX,
             double dY)
Creates a new instance of a World object.

Parameters:
lon - the total longitude of this World in degrees.
lat - the total latitude of this World in degrees.
dX - the width of each grid as latitude degrees. Note that dX cannot exceed lat and should divide it evenly.
dY - the height of each grid as longitude degrees. Note dYthis cannot exceed lon and should divide it evenly. If the conditions of dX and dY are not met, the default size of each grid is 1 x 1 degrees.
Method Detail

addPointToWorld

public boolean addPointToWorld(Point x)
Adds a point to the appropriate grid of this World object.

Returns:
true The point was successfully added to this World.

hemPopulation

public int hemPopulation()
An accessor which returns the total number of points in the world.

changeWeights

public void changeWeights(Triplet[] weights)
A modifier which sets the weight of the PSCF function.

The length of the weights array defines the number of classes. For all other population values which are not defined in weights, the default PSCF value is set to 1.

Parameters:
weights - A new set of weighting factors to be used by the PSCF function.

REQUIRES: weights cannot be null or empty. each element of weights must be instantiated. Redundancy in values is allowed yet not resolved.

tagWorld

public void tagWorld(java.lang.String targetIDW,
                     Pair[] dataW,
                     java.lang.String latR,
                     java.lang.String lonR)
Adds correlated data to points in the world with the appropriate source ID

Parameters:
targetIDW - the desired identifier of each point. Points with this identifier are tagged.
dataW - the data with which to tag the point specified by targetIDW

REQUIRES: dataW is not null or empty. If the identifier cannot be found, the data is not tagged with any point.

applyAdvancedWeight

public void applyAdvancedWeight(java.lang.String calcMethod,
                                AdvancedTriplet[] weights)
Weights the appropriate CWT/QTBA/RTWC weighting functions; if no weight is found or specified, a default weight of 1 is returned. Should be run after at least 1 corresponding calculation, and also BEFORE matrix printing methods are called!

Parameters:
calcMethod - - the calculation method to use

calcMethod = "CWT": the CWT matrix is weighted. must be done after at least 1 CWT matrix is calculated or smoothed

calcMethod = "RTWC": the final RTWC-CWT matrix is weighted after all iterations

calcMethod = "QTBA": the final QTBA matrix is weighted after at least 1 calculation is run

weights; - the floating point weights to apply

public void calcPSCF(Pair[] threshDataW)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Computes PSCF values for points in the World with correlated data.

Parameters:
threshDataW - the threshold data as a Pair of values
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

calcCWT

public void calcCWT(java.lang.String[] varList)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Computes a new matrix of "CWT" values for each grid.

Parameters:
varList; - an array of correlated data variable names, from the correlated data file
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

calcCWTLog

public void calcCWTLog(java.lang.String[] varList)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Computes a new matrix of log-CWT values for each grid

Parameters:
varList - an array of correlated data variable names, derived from the correlated data file
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

smoothCWTField

public void smoothCWTField(java.lang.String[] varList,
                           double ndValue,
                           int filterLength,
                           int polyDegree,
                           double confInt,
                           boolean logField)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Uses an implemented Savitzky-Golay filter with mean-value, left and right padding to smooth the CWT field.

Parameters:
varList - an array of correlated data variable names
ndValue - the value used for representing noData on the CWT grid. NOTE: ndValue should be the same as that specified for printing CWT-matrices to disk (usually, it is -1.000)
filterLength - an odd-numbered length representing 2N+1 (the filter length), where N are the left and right bounds used for data smoothing. Generally, the larger the length of the filter, the greater the smoothing effect.
confInt - the confidence interval (1-probability) of the desired analysis, in decimal format (e.g. 0.95, 0.90, etc.)
polyDegree - a user-defined parameter which specifies the degree of the polynomial to use smoothing with
logField - true if the CWT-field was logarithmically computed, false if it was computed traditionally. REQUIRES: the CWT-matrix MUST already be calculated, and its type (log vs. linear) must be known!
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

reDistConc

public void reDistConc(java.lang.String[] varList,
                       int ndValue)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Uses an RTWC Iterative Method to recalculate and converge the CWT-field. Requires that the LINEAR CWT field has already been calculated for the added data. There is no smoothing in this method and we rely on a linear convergence here.

Parameters:
varList - an array of correlated data variable names
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

calcRTWC

public void calcRTWC(java.lang.String[] varList,
                     int optionSelect,
                     double convPercent,
                     int maxIterations,
                     int pointFilter,
                     int polyDegree,
                     double confInt,
                     int ndValue)
              throws java.lang.Exception
RTWC method which uses redistributed concentration fields with CWT. NOTE: a PREVIOUS CWT CALCULATION NEED NOT BE CONDUCTED; an iteration is counted as a single CWT calculation.

Parameters:
varList - a list of correlated variables
optionSelect - option selection for calculation methods:

optionSelect = 1: linear CWT; no smoothing, fixed iterations (maxIterations)

optionSelect = 2: linear CWT; no smoothing, use convergence criteria % (up to a maxIteration if specified)

optionSelect = 3: add smoothing to option 2.

optionSelect = 4; add smoothing to option 1

convPercent - list the required convergence, IN PERCENT (x100). DEFAULT if <0: 1%
maxIterations - the maximum number of iterations of CWT that should be conducted. If convPercent >= 0, then maxIterations = 1000 by default.
pointFilter - an odd-numbered length representing 2N+1 (the filter length), where N is the left and right bound used for data smoothing. Generally, the larger the length of the filter, the greater the smoothing effect
ndValue - the value used for representing "no Data" on the CWT grid. NOTE: ndValue should be the same as that which is specified for printing a null CWT matrices. MUST BE LESS THAN ZERO. Typically, -1.00 is used.
polyDegree - a user-defined parameter which specifies the degree of the polynomial to use smoothing with
confInt - the confidence interval (1-probability) of the desired analysis in decimal format (0.95, 0.999, etc.)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

calcQTBA

public void calcQTBA(java.lang.String[] varList,
                     double a)
Performs QTBA calculations on the entire world for every pollutant. ONLY HYSPLIT FILES CAN BE USED. The calculation methods are relatively simple.

Parameters:
varList - an array of correlated data variable names, from the correlated data file
a - the atmospheric dispersion velocity (see the MetCor implementation note on QTBA); provide value in km/hr.

avgGridNatT

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> avgGridNatT(java.lang.String[] varList)
Generates the average valueof the Natural Transport Potential Function; averaged across all grids (with tagged endpoints). Returns a formatted block of text which can be written to disk by CMCRender.

Parameters:
varList - the list of correlated variables

avgTaggedNIJ

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> avgTaggedNIJ(java.lang.String[] varList)
Generates the average tagged Grid population across all grids (with tagged endpoints). Returns a formatted block of text which can be written to disk by CMCRender.

Parameters:
varList - the list of correlated variables

                        throws java.lang.Exception
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getMaxNIJ

public int getMaxNIJ()
Returns the largest number of points found in any grid of this World.

All Points, including ones which have no correlated data, are included in the calculation.

getHistData

public java.lang.String[] getHistData(int intervals)
Returns a tab-delimited histogram enumerating the population of each grid and the frequency at which this population is observed. Points with and without correlated data are enumerated.

The bin size of this histogram is determined by the range of populations observed in each grid and intervals.

Parameters:
intervals - the number of classes to use in generating the histogram. A larger interval yields a more resolved histogram.

REQUIRES: intervals must be greater or equal to 1.

getTaggedHistData

public java.lang.String[] getTaggedHistData(int intervals)
Returns a tab-delimited histogram enumerating the population of each grid and the frequency at which this population is observed. Only points with correlated data are enumerated.

The bin size of this histogram is determined by the range of populations observed in each grid and intervals.

Parameters:
intervals - the number of classes to use in generating the histogram. A larger interval yields a more resolved histogram.

REQUIRES: intervals must be greater or equal to 1.

getPSCFHist

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getPSCFHist(Pair[] threshData)
Returns a tab delimited scatter plot of grid population vs. PSCF for each grid in this world. Grids with no points get a "no-data" PSCF value -1.0

Parameters:
threshData - A pair of correlated data containing the name of the pollutants in the same order as the correlated data of all points.

getTaggedHistSource

public java.lang.String[] getTaggedHistSource(int intervals)

Returns a 2D matrix for the set of PSCF values

Parameters:
index - the 3rd-dimensional index of the PSCF matrix
nDValue - no data value. Must be less than 0.

index - the 3rd-dimensional index of the CWT matrix
ndValue - no data value. Must be less than 0.
